channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside no.68 Cobourg St, 15th January
item.description:
This pavement slab is uneven and is a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60-68, Cobourg Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London

item.title: Railway footbridge from Petts Wood Rd to Queensway slippery to walk on., 15th January
item.description:
There has been no apparent gritting Mornings particularly hazardous and footbridge only one available till March. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Queensway, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 streets lights are out, 15th January
item.description:
3 street lights are not working on Low Cross Wood Lane. It is an uneven path and at some points in the evening very quiet. It currently feels unsafe. Some of the lights have been out for at least 6 weeks. Please can you fix this as soon as possible. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Low Cross Wood Lane, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain on the corner of Hawkwood lane and manor park road, closest to the house on the corner with the broken fence, 15th January
item.description:
Blocked drain has been there for months and causes huge water to build up. When dry you can see mud all the way to the top, under the grate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watts Lane, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On Ashleigh Road laughing gas bottles in blue Co-Op bag dumped onto pavement., 15th January
item.description:
Laughing gas bottles were dumped in blue Co-op shopping bag on pavement corner of my road. I tired to dispose of them myself by taking them to recycling centre but the centre will not take them. I was told to report it to the council for proper disposal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashleigh Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On Chevening Road at the corner of Tiverton Rod, 15th January
item.description:
The whole street needs cleaning but also people have started using the salt bin as a place to dump their dog poo bags. It's unsightly, unhygienic and really gross. The whole of Chevening Road needs street cleaning - as like with Tiverton - people seem to drive to the park and then dump their litter by the park on the road and pavement

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chevening Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rothsay Street, Walworth, Greater London

item.title: All street lights going off in the early hours., 15th January
item.description:
All Montrave Road Street lights are going off in the early hours of the morning leaving this road in complete darkness until sunrise. The lights are then coming on during the day!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montrave Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves that were not cleared are now a slippery hazard, 15th January
item.description:
There are a number of areas around Camberwell including Peckham Road outside 36-38 Peckham Road on the pavement, Camberwell Grove areas of slimy leaves on pavement, Grove Park slimy leaves and areas with heaps of leaves on road mostly (are now crushed and slimy) but some on pavements. When they are not cleared they then fill up the drains with broken down leaves becoming silt.The leaves have been like this since November 2025.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17a, Grove Park, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brambles covering fire hydrant, 15th January
item.description:
We have a fire hydrant here but it has been covered over by brambles. If you look at the Streetview attached I have circled the H plate showing where the hydrant is. Unfortunately the clearing of these brambles is too big a job for our hydrant technician. We would be grateful if the council could attend and uncover the fire hydrant cover which is at the side of the road. It should have 'FH' on the cover.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartford Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
